My Story

My name is Inesa Balic-Klicic, I was born and raised in Bihac, Bosnia and Herzegovina. Like so many artists I was a "special snowflake" during my childhood and most of my time I have spend reading/writing poetry and novels, but most of all I was always drawing and painting something. When I look back, my artistic side was my path and my stumbling stone through out my childhood. I have always been wondering and asking myself is it possible to live in Bosnia and to make a living doing what you love. I had to overcome many obstacles and I was always fighting windmills, but now I see it was the best possible journey because all the hardship made everything more valuable and worthwhile. Hometown Bihac is my biggest inspiration, and I honestly believe that all the artists who come to Bihac fall in love with this town and its river Una. One cannot resist to be in love with it, it truly captivates you.

After I finished Art high school and Gymnasium, I had no opportunity at that time to sign up for Academy of fine arts and decided to finish Faculty of pedagogy in Bihac. In the meantime I started to work on my drawing skills, spent most of my free time on drawing and learning all the new techniques, and now I know it was the best thing to do. I choose my reference photographies over my subjective feeling about them, I love dark, artistic photos, it give me chance to find all that darkness and shadows on my empty white paper, it is like I’m in some kind of Limbo. I mostly draw black and white, with graphite pencils and charcoal, but I also like to rest my pencils sometimes and to enjoy painting. When I paint I love vibrant colors, landscapes and waterscapes with lots of light, sunsets, sunrises, water reflections... My hometown is my biggest inspiration, I thing that all the artist who have been in Bihac are in some way in live with this town and river Una, you must be in love with it, it captivates you, truly. There are a lots of artists that inspire me, mostly in hyperrealism and nadrealism, and aquarelle masters inspire me, one of my biggest inspirations in hyperrealism is Emanuel Dascanio, his artworks are so perfect I think it would bring me to tears if I had opportunity to look at his drawings in person, it is so magnificent you can’t bare it. When I’m not drawing, I usualy enjoy cooking, reading, watching movies or just riding bike and hanging with my friends in wilderness, I love nature and all my friends are also nature lovers, we are almost every weekend (when it is not winter here) somewhere else outside the city rush. The first thing I do when I’m about to start drawing is to turn on my music, it is like every drawing has her own soundtrack. I mostly listen to alternative and experimental rock and when I’m in realy good mood I liste to metal, and my all time music favorites are: Nick Cave, Pink Floyd, Pearl Jam, Leonard Cohen, Metallica, Iron Maiden... I know it is such a strange music mix but I cant help myself lol.

I think my favorite saying is: “Don’t take life too seriously.”, simple as that, I think that life is all about joy, when you lock yourself into grown-up for lifetime you don’t have fun anymore you just get old and grumpy, and miss all the fun life gives to you, I think you can let yourself to only get better not older. The last thing I drew was some charcoal portrait drawing last night just to have a mind break from my graphite pencils.
